definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: Entry form is invalid if not properly completed or with insufficient supporting materials.
sentences.chinese: 报名表填写不清或资料不齐者，一概视为无效。

sentences.english: The "parent" handles all responsibilities, while the "naughty child" has none.
sentences.chinese: “主”掌握所有的职责，而“小淘气”一概不管。

sentences.english: " Mother" will have you discussing the plot, not entirely to your satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 《母亲》会让你思考情节，而并非一概满足你的想象。

sentences.english: With that overturned, the clan authority and the authority of the husband all begin to totter.
sentences.chinese: 它既被打翻，族权和夫权便一概跟着动摇起来。

sentences.english: I know nothing to the contrary.
sentences.chinese: 与此相反之事我一概不知。

sentences.english: Any general claim will be belied by a particular experience.
sentences.chinese: 任何一概而论的说法都会被具体经历推翻。

sentences.english: Independent thinking is a precise necessity in study.
sentences.chinese: 独立忖量对进修是一概必需的。

sentences.english: It's an acceptable stereotype to make a generalization from.
sentences.chinese: 人们可以接受用这个刻板印象来以一概全。

sentences.english: However, the blame cannot be put solely on the recipients of abortion.
sentences.chinese: 但是，不能一概地把责备归在流产者身上。

sentences.english: Auto-accept file transfer requests from selected users.
sentences.chinese: 来自选取了的使用者的档案传输要求一概自动接受。

sentences.english: Never get into fights with ugly people- they haudio-videoe nothing to lose.
sentences.chinese: 一概不要和长得丑的争辩，他们仍然没什么可输的了。

sentences.english: He plays golf to the exclusion of all other sports.
sentences.chinese: 他专打高尔夫球，其他的运动一概不参加。

sentences.english: Eg. I know nothing to the contrary.
sentences.chinese: 与此相反之事我一概不知。

sentences.english: She swallows everything that is said to her.
sentences.chinese: 别人封她说的任何事她一概相信。

definition: solely engrossed in one thing/just (one thing, no need to worry about the rest)/simply/by all means/please feel free/do not hesitate (to ask for sth)
to show an interest in/to get involved with
to accept without question/to take sth at face value
to pay no attention to/to disregard/to ignore/to let go unpunished/to let off
to pay no heed to (idiom)/to ignore/to brush aside
life or death/fate/no matter what/anyway/for the life of me
and so on/so and so/many and confused
